definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots
bird shotgun replaced by cannon (idiom); equipment improved enormously

sentences.english: I calmed her down as Kayla sneaked out of the house with a shotgun.
sentences.chinese: 我讓她平靜下來，凱拉於是帶着一支鳥槍出去了。

sentences.english: A strategy of shotgun antisense gene silencing was used to generate a rice mutant library.
sentences.chinese: 嘗試利用鳥槍反義基因沉默策略構建水稻突變體庫。

sentences.english: He peppered the wild ducks with bird shot.
sentences.chinese: 他用鳥槍向野鴨子射擊。

sentences.english: The earliest examples were the fowling pieces that appeared in 16th-century Europe.
sentences.chinese: 最早的是16世紀時出現於歐洲的鳥槍。
